objtitle.title: An Old Man Seated Leaning on a Pile of Books; A Young Man Approaches

objdescid.compdate: c. 1789This date, given in Butlin 235, is based on stylistic considerations and is far from certain. The head of the seated figure is very similar to the figure's head in *Fate*, a pencil sketch dated to c. 1793 in Butlin 210.

objinfo.leafsize: 34.1 x 43.8 cm.The fact that the head of the figure standing on the right is cut off suggests that the leaf was trimmed at the top after the drawing was executed.

provenance.name: Rosenbach Museum and Library
provenance.note: Early history unknown; William A. White by 1905; acquired by the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach, probably c. 1927-29; bequeathed to the Rosenbach Museum and Library in 1952 and accessioned by the Museum in 1954.

desc.objtitle: *An Old Man Seated Leaning on a Pile of Books; A Young Man Approaches*, object 1 (Butlin 235 recto)

objnote.p: A pencil drawing, *A Seated Man*, is on the verso of this drawing.

illustration.illusobjdesc: A seated male figure with short curly hair and a beard looks right toward a second male figure, who stands against the right edge of the drawing. The seated figure appears to be nude. His torso faces forward, and his left leg is bent upward in front of him, his right extended left. His right arm is at his side while his left is bent upward with his elbow resting on a pile of books. He may touch his face with his left hand. The standing figure, whose head is only partially visible against the upper margin, has long curly hair and faces left. He appears to be nude expect for a length of drapery worn over his left shoulder. His left arm is bent and raised at 45 degrees, and the fingers of his left hand are spread. His right foot is positioned in front of his left; the musculature of both legs is prominent.

component.illusobjdesc: A seated male figure with short curly hair and a beard looks right toward a second male figure, who stands against the right edge of the drawing. The seated figure appears to be nude. His torso faces forward, and his left leg is bent upward in front of him, his right extended left. His right arm is at his side (perhaps touching his right knee) while his left is bent upward with his elbow resting on a pile of books. He may touch his face with his left hand.

The standing figure, whose head is only partially visible against the upper margin, has long curly hair and faces left. He appears to be nude expect for a length of drapery worn over his left shoulder. His left arm is bent and raised at 45 degrees, and the fingers of his left hand are spread. His right foot is positioned in front of his left, which suggests the figure may walk left. The musculature of both legs is prominent.

The sitting figure rests his left elbow on a stack of at least three books. One or two other books are arranged vertically, leaning to the right, visible at the seated figure's left elbow. The edges of a few pages of the vertical books may be pictured.
